title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHICAGO — The final score read Chicago 105, Charlotte 92, but the numbers that truly mattered were 49, 13, and 8. In a performance that transcended the regular season, Michael Jordan authored another legendary chapter, scoring a season-high 49 points to power the Bulls past the Charlotte Hornets.

From the opening tip, Jordan was in a relentless rhythm, dissecting the Charlotte defense with a virtuoso display. He attacked the rim with ferocity, hit from mid-range with cold-blooded precision, and finished the night an efficient 18-of-33 from the field. His 13 rebounds were a testament to his all-around dominance, while his 8 assists proved he was elevating his teammates even on a night he could not be stopped.

The Hornets, led by Glen Rice’s 22 points, had no answer. Every time they threatened to close the gap, Jordan had a response—a steal leading to a fast-break dunk, a dagger jumper over a helpless defender, or a drive through a thicket of arms for an and-one. Scottie Pippen provided crucial support with 16 points, but this was Jordan’s symphony.

In a season where every game was a step toward history, Jordan’s 49-point eruption served as a stunning reminder of his singular greatness. It was more than a win; it was a statement. On a Chicago night, Michael Jordan didn’t just beat the opponent; he captivated the basketball world, once again.
